title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Gloucester, England)
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. It felt more like a chat rather than an interview. They like to get to know you as a person and ask why you would like to volunteer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Dewsbury, England) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: They called me to ask few questions. And then ask me to visit the store and have spent 2 hours to work there. They asked me if I was familiar to use computer. Then the store manager had demo and I started to work on it
Interview Questions: Why you want to apply this job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: Fantastic recruitment team. Speedy and friendly. Passionate from the back office to my visit. Leadership team very transparent of job role and charity, which I appreciated. Interview was booked quickly with relevant leaders from nursing and HR, so felt fair and equitable. Interview was very values based, I felt the team wanted to genuinely understand my values, skills and experience, rather than text book answers.
Interview Questions: Describe Clinical Leadership?

title: Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sue Ryder
Interview Descriptions: No preparation. Super chill. Was asked about hobbies and any previous experience (even though it’s not required). Training was given for few weeks then brought onto the main shop floor.
Interview Questions: Have you done any charity work before

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sue Ryder
Interview Descriptions: I was asked questions about why I want to volunteer and questions about the different skills I can bring to the team. The interviewer was  very nice and explained the roles and how the whole shop  works.
Interview Questions: Why do   you want to volunteer at Sue Ryder

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder
Interview Descriptions: Rushed through answers - didn't get to answer properly or fully, not inclusive, reasonable adjustments not implement, interviewers seem poorly prepared, not given time to ask the questions I wanted.
Interview Questions: Why want to work there

title: Volunteering Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sue Ryder
Interview Descriptions:
Quick and easy process. Questions about work schedule.
Very friendly and open to help. The whole interview lasted around 20 minutes. Very pleasant and rewarding experience. I accepted the position with this company.
Interview Questions: Questions about my previous volunteering experience.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Bournemouth, England) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my retail experience and what I did at asda how long I had been in the job and what I did I explained what I had done and told them about myself
Interview Questions: Experience in job and about myself

title: Volunteer Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder
Interview Descriptions: I found the volunteering opportunity online and was told to phone the store that I wanted to volunterer at. After I was told to go into the store for a discussion to see what past training i have done and what times i am available.
Interview Questions: whether I had any previous experience so that they can see what training i have done in the past

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Rickmansworth, England)
Interview Descriptions: I sat with the area manager in a stock room, answering questions about my experiences of being a volunteer and bank staff and what made me good for the job
Interview Questions: Why did i think i was good for the job

title: Domestic Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Reading, England) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three people; the head of services, the manager of services and the domestic supervisor.  The head of services was a nice and friendly individual who made me feel at ease during the interview however the other two members of staff interviewing me were not so nice.  I was asked a set of 8 competency based questions and it was points scored.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Sue Ryder?

title: Community Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Peterborough, England) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: applied online, waited two weeks then had phone call interview with hiring manager then received an email to say i was successful and been invited to second stage interview with director and senior manager.
Interview Questions: competency based questions

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder
Interview Descriptions: very brief but staff were very friendly and made me feel at ease there was one lady asking me questions and  this was done in an informal friendly manner didn't feel like an interview
Interview Questions: was asked about my availability and also any past experience that I may have but I didn't have any and this wasn't a problem also was asked

title: PR Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (London, England) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very straight-forward, spoke to one contact in HR, good interview, clear and friendly. So far everything has gone smoothly. I had to do a presentation and then usual interview questions.
Interview Questions: Talk about campaign experience, line management and reputation managment.

title: Retail Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sue Ryder in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy and quick. They only asked me a couple of questions  about my availability and why I wanted to work for the company. They were friendly and the interview was very relaxed/chill.
Interview Questions:
What is your avaliability?
Why do you want to work for us?

title: Shop Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (London, England) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on different steps of process, where in each moment I feel comfortable and the people of Sue Ryder in each moment was very nice on the process. I feel some times I could no understand what they were asking but they have a lot o patience with me and help me to understand and feel  security of myself in each moment. I have my interview with the recruitment manager, area manager and other manager, all of then very polite and professional.
Interview Questions: They ask you like in all job interviews about yourself,  and they want you explain experience refereed to the position of the job with exact examples on the last job.  They ask about hypothetical situation and how you solved it.

title: Assistant Shop Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Waterlooville, England) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Formal interview asking questions about situations and how I would respond to them, and examples were requested.
Scenarios were also give and was expected to respond in a reasonable and fashionable way.
Was expected to show them that I was a suitable candidate for the role with the experience and knowledge that I had.
Interview Questions: If you had an angry customer come into the shop what would you do or say?

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Portsmouth, Isle of Wight, South East England, England) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview went very well and the people were lovely. It was like chatting to new friends. I was made to feel very welcome and left there feeling good about myself.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Database Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (London, England) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth process. I've been invited to the 1st interview within a few days from the closing date for the post, was interviewed the following week. My 2nd interview was a week later. The offer arrived 2 days after the last interview.

title: Fundraising Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (London, England) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two members of the Fundraising Opps team, from the beginning they made sure that I was comfortable and that the process was as informal as possible. They were very supportive and positive and it made the whole experience very enjoyable!
Interview Questions: What are some of your weaknesses?

title: Counsellor At Thorpe Hall, Peterborough Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Peterborough, England) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was made very welcome and felt at ease.  I was interviewed by two very professional female colleagues (to be) who spent time asking me questions and were very interested in my answers.  The whole process was very pleasant, energising and with an excellent outcome.
Interview Questions: What do I have in place to ensure that I maintain a good work /life balance?

title: Shop Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not so hard, based on situational questions. And what would you in certain situation, what would you do to improve your customer service skills? What is your experience related to sales, retail, customer service and shop management?
Interview Questions: What do you do to go extra miles in customer service?

title: RRIC Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (London, England) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Competency based, so as long as you tick the boxes that’s all that counts. Don’t give them more, they are not interested. Presentation about the job, role play an interview situation and a formal question interview.
Interview Questions: Do a presentation about the RRIC role.

title: Retail Sales Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Northallerton, England) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process made me feel alot more relaxed than i was feeling as i was quite nervous. I felt i knew alot of the information needed as i had already volunteered for the charity for 14 months prior to applying for the job.
Interview Questions: Do you know about Sue Ryder As a charity

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Ruislip, England) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Really thorough, detailed questions and friendly interviewers. Felt very happy with the experience as I was given clear details of what the job would entail and what would be expected of myself.
Interview Questions: What experience can you bring to this job role?

title: Volunteer Support Administrator At Royal Brit Leg Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (London, England)
Interview Descriptions: Interview NOT at SR, but AT Royal Brit Leg. Send in a CV and supporting statement. Questions were all competency based. NO questions on why I wanted to the join the RBL, nor interests and hobbies. There was a test beforehand which seemed were reasonable. Very little opportunity for an interviewee to show that they have read the Financial Statement beforehand.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult situation with a member of staff?

title: Area Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (London, England) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: very unorganized, kept waiting on 1st interview, questions were scripted and set in stone and interviewers wouldn't deviate from their script. Vague answers to job responsibilities and felt even they didn't want to be in their role - slightly unprofessional -2nd interview was rushed with lots of activities to get through, some times were cut short and tasks seemed unrelated to role advertised.
Interview Questions: why do you want this job

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Morecambe, England) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went for a wee hour interview and taster session. Stayed for 7hrs. I committed to 3 or 4 half days depending on the week. I was asked which of these I could do but said all. But I had the option to change this and to sort of drop-off and help when I liked.
Interview Questions: Had I done any job similar previously.

title: Retail Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Preston, North West England, England) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sat in the store on one of the couches that were for sale, for a really informal 'interview' it was more of a discussion into why i wanted to volunteer and what i was doing at the moment. The manager was lovely and every friendly, she went through things that would be involved in the job such as duties, i was asked when i was available, and asked about any convictions etc, i filled out a form there and then and agreed to a date and time when i would start.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Sue Ryder and why do you want to volunteer?

title: Area Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sue Ryder (Torquay, England) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through an agency.
Had formal interview above a store with regional manager and an area manager.
General questions but not given time to give answers very rushed.
Not made to feel comfortable straight into questioning.
Extremely in personal very frosty regional manager.
Got through to second stage assessment centre.
Down to 3 canidates made to feel they had already made their minds up.
Unfair negative attitude from regional manager.
Happy I didn't get the job!!!
Interview Questions: None, Assessment centre tasks were team based (although who shouted loudest seemed to have got the job) written task about analysing figures and reports, role play task with area manager about a manager who wasn't rotating her stock and merchandising regularly.
